Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
CAN: Draw a basic outline of a land and water habitat (e.g., grass and a wavy line for water).
Include some random shapes or lines that may resemble plants or animals (e.g., circles, sticks) without clear identification.
CANNOT: Show or label specific habitats like a playground, garden, forest, pond, or lake *(may draw unrelated shapes or scribbles)*.
Correctly draw and label specific plants and animals in each habitat *(drawings might include incorrect or imaginary creatures instead)*.
Label at least two plants and two animals in each habitat to highlight diversity *(labels might be missing or nonspecific)*(e.g., 'thing').
Compare living things in the two habitats by drawing and labeling differences and similarities *(little to no comparison attempted)*.
Illustrate patterns of plant and animal diversity in different habitats *(no recognition of diversity; may think all environments have the same living things)*.
